title: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 Exhibition
blurb: Inspiring young minds with art since 2017.
description: The Gallery Children's Biennale has been one of National Gallery Singapore’s signature events since 2017, embodying the Gallery's commitment to inspire young and curious minds with art. It aims to explore the many ways that children can learn and play while engaging more with the world around them. The Biennale is committed to providing an inclusive experience for all, with wheelchair accessibility via a wheelchair-friendly route that connects all the artworks. Most artworks have step-free access and are wheelchair accessible, except for Fantasy due to the cushioned flooring, which can still be viewed from the entrance. Stroller parking is available in designated areas around the installations.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale 2025
blurb: Inspiring young minds with art since 2017.
description: The Gallery Children's Biennale has been one of National Gallery Singapore’s signature events since 2017, embodying the Gallery's commitment to inspire young and curious minds with art. It aims to explore the many ways that children can learn and play while engaging more with the world around them. The Biennale is committed to providing an inclusive experience for all, with wheelchair-friendly routes connecting all the artworks. Most artworks have step-free access and are wheelchair accessible, except for Fantasy due to the cushioned flooring. However, the work can still be viewed from the entrance. There are special areas designated for stroller parking around the different installations. You will be asked to leave your stroller in these areas while you explore the exhibitions. Key points to note: Wheelchair Accessibility There is a wheelchair-friendly route that connects all the artworks, so you can easily explore the event. Most artworks have step-free access and are wheelchair accessible, except for Fantasy due to the cushioned flooring. However, the work can still be viewed from the entrance.

title: Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025
blurb: Explore art through interactive installations.
description: The Gallery Children’s Biennale 2025 offers an inclusive experience for all, featuring wheelchair-friendly routes connecting the artworks. Most artworks have step-free access, except for Fantasy, which can be viewed from the entrance. Accessible toilets are located near Lift Lobbies A and B. Note that some artworks like Lessons in Being Kind, Imaginary Peach Garden and Dance Dance Chromatics have dim lighting. Stroller parking is available around the installations. Food and drinks are not allowed near the artwork or in the galleries. Be gentle when handling the artworks, use your indoor voice, walk instead of run, and wait your turn to experience the art.

title: SG Artist Series Exhibitions
blurb: Exhibitions spotlighting Singaporean artists.
description: Celebrate Singapore's 59th birthday with exhibitions showcasing four unique Singaporean artists as part of the “SG Artist Series”. See works by Cheong Soo Pieng, Teo Eng Seng, Kim Lim, and Lim Tze Peng. Opening in September and October. Gallery Insiders go for free. Explore the diverse artistic expressions and contributions of these visionary artists, each offering a unique perspective on Singaporean identity and heritage. The exhibitions provide an enriching experience for art enthusiasts and those interested in learning more about Singapore's cultural landscape. Discover the evolution of Singaporean art through the works of these influential figures.

title: Laws of Our Land: Foundations of a New Nation
blurb: Exhibition on laws shaping modern Singapore.
description: Explore the 'Laws of Our Land: Foundations of a New Nation' exhibition, organised by the National Library Board, at the former Chief Justice's Chamber and Office. View artefacts spotlighting pivotal laws shaping modern-day Singapore. Learn about the historical context of the Citizenship Ordinance, Women's Charter, and Employment Act through digital resources, video screenings, interactive games, and augmented reality. Singaporeans and PRs enjoy free admission. Guided tours are available on the third Friday of each month. Discover the legal foundations that have shaped Singapore's development.

title: National Gallery Singapore Family Visit
blurb: Interactive art, culture, history, and chill spaces.
description: Visit National Gallery Singapore for a family-friendly experience. Enjoy interactive art for kids, a dose of culture and history for adults, and chill spaces for relaxation. With affordable admission for locals, it's a worthwhile family outing. Explore the diverse collection of Southeast Asian art, participate in engaging activities, and create lasting memories with your loved ones. The gallery offers a variety of exhibitions and programs suitable for all ages, making it an ideal destination for a fun and educational family day.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale
blurb: Explore the endless possibilities of the future.
description: The fifth edition of Gallery Children's Biennale invites children to reflect on the endless possibilities of their future by exploring the four core values of Joy, Kindness, Dream and Love. Both children and adults can look forward to eight multi-sensorial artworks by local and international artists, as well as a series of fun and engaging programmes throughout the Biennale period. Joy: It is a warm feeling that sits deep in our hearts and bubbles up when we delight in something that is meaningful and special to us. Kindness: Being friendly and polite, caring and considerate to others can help them feel safe, valued and included. Don’t forget to be kind to yourself too. Do things that make you happy. Love: It is a feeling that makes us feel happy, valued and safe. We receive love and we also give love. Dream: Imagination fuels art, and what you dream today can shape a kind, inclusive, diverse world.
datetime_display: friendly and polite, caring and considerate to others can help them feel safe, valued and included

title: Gallery Children’s Biennale
blurb: Explore joy and kindness through art.
description: The Gallery Children’s Biennale explores themes of joy and kindness, inviting children and families to reflect on what brings them joy and how they can be kind to themselves and others. Through interactive artworks and engaging activities, visitors can discover the importance of empathy, compassion, and self-care. The exhibition aims to create a safe and inclusive space where children can express themselves, connect with others, and learn valuable life lessons through the power of art. It encourages families to engage in meaningful conversations and create lasting memories together, fostering a sense of community and belonging.

title: Kindness at National Gallery Singapore
blurb: Explore kindness through art.
description: Discover how being friendly, polite, caring, and considerate can make others feel safe, valued, and included. Remember to be kind to yourself by doing things that bring you joy at National Gallery Singapore.

title: Love at National Gallery Singapore
blurb: Explore the feeling of love through art.
description: Reflect on love and the people who bring you happiness, value, and safety. Explore the concept of giving and receiving love at National Gallery Singapore.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale - Love
blurb: Explore feelings of happiness, value, and safety.
description: Reflect on the feeling of love, which makes us feel happy, valued, and safe. We receive love and we also give love. Consider who you think about when you think about love and how it manifests in your life and the lives of others. This exhibit encourages introspection and appreciation for the connections we share.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale - Dream
blurb: Imagine your future as a fireman, artist, or astronaut.
description: Explore the power of imagination and its role in shaping a kind, inclusive, and diverse world. Consider where you see yourself in the future – will you be a fireman, artist, or astronaut? This exhibit highlights how imagination fuels art and encourages visitors to dream big and envision a better tomorrow through creativity and innovation.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale: Dream
blurb: Imagination fuels art for a diverse world.
description: Explore the theme of 'Dream' at the Gallery Children's Biennale. Discover how imagination fuels art and shapes a kind, inclusive, diverse world. Consider your future self – will you be a fireman, artist, or astronaut? Engage with art that sparks creativity and encourages dreaming big. Take a quiz to find out what tomorrow will bring, filled with joy, kindness, dreams, and love. This exhibition encourages children to explore their aspirations and the possibilities of the future through interactive and thought-provoking artworks.

title: Colourful Play by Fern Wong
blurb: Complete a papercut design with patterned magnets.
description: Help complete a papercut design. Patterned magnets are provided to finish this huge papercut artwork. This interactive installation encourages creativity and collaboration, allowing children to engage with art in a hands-on way. The activity promotes fine motor skills and artistic expression in a fun and engaging environment. Families can work together to create their own unique designs, fostering a sense of shared accomplishment and artistic exploration. The artwork provides a colourful and stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: Dance Chromatics by Wyn-Lyn Tan
blurb: Wave your hands and feet to see colours appear.
description: Wave your hands in the air and move your feet. What colours appear? Do shapes start to change? Let’s try to unlock all the changes! This interactive installation encourages movement and exploration of colours and shapes. Children can engage with the artwork by dancing and observing how their movements affect the visual display. The activity promotes physical activity and sensory awareness in a fun and engaging environment. Families can participate together, fostering a sense of shared discovery and artistic exploration. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through movement.

title: Fantasy by CO2_karbondioksida
blurb: Artwork made from repurposed baby clothes and toys.
description: This artwork is inspired by our two-year-old daughter, Quinn. We have created this piece by repurposing pre-loved baby clothes and toys. This installation showcases the creative reuse of materials and encourages viewers to consider the potential for transforming everyday objects into art. Children can engage with the artwork by observing the different textures and patterns created by the repurposed materials. The activity promotes environmental awareness and creative thinking in a fun and engaging environment. Families can discuss the importance of recycling and repurposing, fostering a sense of responsibility and artistic appreciation. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: Imaginary Peach Garden by YeSeung Lee
blurb: Inspired by puzzles, creatures, and Korean paintings.
description: For this artwork, I was inspired by tazo puzzles, mythical creatures from Korean and Southeast Asian stories and traditional Korean paintings. This installation combines elements of fantasy and cultural heritage, inviting viewers to explore a whimsical world filled with imaginative characters and vibrant imagery. Children can engage with the artwork by identifying the different creatures and patterns inspired by Korean and Southeast Asian folklore. The activity promotes cultural awareness and creative thinking in a fun and engaging environment. Families can discuss the stories and traditions behind the artwork, fostering a sense of appreciation for diverse cultures and artistic expression. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: Home is Where the Heart is by Salehuddin
blurb: Inspired by Malay House, Malacca painting.
description: When you think of the word “home” what do you think of? This artwork is inspired by the painting Malay House, Malacca by Mohamed Salehuddin. This installation explores the concept of home and its significance in our lives. Children can engage with the artwork by reflecting on their own experiences of home and sharing their thoughts and feelings. The activity promotes self-reflection and emotional awareness in a fun and engaging environment. Families can discuss the meaning of home and its importance in their lives, fostering a sense of connection and belonging. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: I WE THEM by Vicente Delgado
blurb: Chairs come to life as playful characters.
description: For this work, I invite you into a whimsical world where chairs come to life as playful characters and vibrant beings! This installation transforms ordinary chairs into extraordinary works of art, inviting viewers to engage with them in new and imaginative ways. Children can interact with the artwork by exploring the different shapes, colors, and textures of the chairs. The activity promotes creative thinking and sensory awareness in a fun and engaging environment. Families can discuss the personalities and stories of the chairs, fostering a sense of connection and artistic appreciation. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: Kindness Garden by Hiromi Tango
blurb: A colourful garden of sunflowers, roses, lavenders.
description: I created this colourful garden of sunflowers, roses, lavenders and some orchids too! Each flower can be experienced through different senses. This installation invites viewers to explore a vibrant and sensory-rich garden filled with colorful flowers. Children can engage with the artwork by touching, smelling, and observing the different flowers. The activity promotes sensory awareness and appreciation for nature in a fun and engaging environment. Families can discuss the different types of flowers and their unique characteristics, fostering a sense of connection and artistic appreciation. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: Lessons In Being Kind by Souliya Phoumivong
blurb: Watch a short film exploring themes of kindness.
description: Come experience this installation and watch a short film I created that explores the themes of kindness. Think about how you can extend kindness to people around you. This installation invites viewers to reflect on the importance of kindness and its impact on our lives. Children can engage with the artwork by watching the short film and discussing the different ways they can show kindness to others. The activity promotes empathy and social awareness in a fun and engaging environment. Families can share their own experiences of kindness and discuss the importance of treating others with respect and compassion. The artwork provides a stimulating experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to explore their imagination and express themselves through art.

title: All Joy Colourful Play by Fern Wong
blurb: Complete a papercut design with patterned magnets.
description: Help complete this papercut design. Patterned magnets are provided to finish this huge papercut artwork. This interactive installation encourages creativity and collaboration, allowing visitors to engage with art in a hands-on manner. Explore the use of patterns and shapes to create a unique and personalized artwork. The activity promotes fine motor skills and artistic expression in a fun and engaging environment. It's a great opportunity for families to work together and create a memorable piece of art.

title: Joy Dance Dance Chromatics by Wyn-Lyn Tan
blurb: Wave your hands and feet to change colors and shapes.
description: Wave your hands in the air and move your feet. What colours appear? Do shapes start to change? Let’s try to unlock all the changes! This interactive installation responds to movement, creating a dynamic and engaging experience for visitors. Explore the relationship between color, shape, and motion as you interact with the artwork. The installation encourages physical activity and creative expression, allowing visitors to become part of the art itself. It's a fun and immersive way to explore the world of art and technology.

title: Dream Fantasy by CO2_karbondioksida
blurb: Artwork made from repurposed baby clothes and toys.
description: This artwork is inspired by our two-year-old daughter, Quinn. We have created this piece by repurposing pre-loved baby clothes and toys. The installation explores themes of sustainability and creativity, showcasing how everyday objects can be transformed into art. Visitors can reflect on the importance of reducing waste and finding new uses for discarded items. The artwork also celebrates the innocence and wonder of childhood, inviting viewers to reconnect with their own sense of imagination and play.

title: Dream Imaginary Peach Garden by YeSeung Lee
blurb: Inspired by puzzles, myths, and Korean paintings.
description: This artwork is inspired by tazo puzzles, mythical creatures from Korean and Southeast Asian stories and traditional Korean paintings. The installation creates a whimsical and enchanting environment, inviting visitors to explore a world of imagination and folklore. Discover hidden symbols and narratives within the artwork, and learn about the rich cultural heritage that inspired its creation. The piece encourages curiosity and storytelling, allowing visitors to connect with art on a deeper level.

title: Love Home is Where the Heart is by Mohamed Salehuddin
blurb: Inspired by Malay House, Malacca painting.
description: When you think of the word “home” what do you think of? This artwork is inspired by the painting Malay House, Malacca by Mohamed Salehuddin. The installation explores the concept of home and belonging, inviting visitors to reflect on their own personal experiences and memories. Discover the cultural significance of the Malay house and its role in shaping community and identity. The artwork encourages introspection and dialogue, allowing visitors to connect with art on a deeper emotional level.

title: Love I WE THEM by Vicente Delgado
blurb: Chairs come to life as playful characters.
description: For this work, I invite you into a whimsical world where chairs come to life as playful characters and vibrant beings! The installation creates a surreal and imaginative environment, inviting visitors to interact with the artwork and explore the boundaries between reality and fantasy. Discover the hidden personalities and stories of each chair, and reflect on the role of everyday objects in shaping our perceptions and experiences. The artwork encourages creativity and playfulness, allowing visitors to connect with art on a deeper emotional level.

title: Kindness Lessons In Being Kind by Souliya Phoumivong
blurb: Experience an installation and watch a short film.
description: Come experience this installation and watch a short film I created that explores the themes of kindness. Think about how you can extend kindness to people around you. The installation creates a reflective and thought-provoking environment, inviting visitors to consider the importance of empathy and compassion in our daily lives. Discover the power of small acts of kindness and their impact on individuals and communities. The artwork encourages introspection and social awareness, allowing visitors to connect with art on a deeper emotional level.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale Artists' Showcase
blurb: Discover artists from around the world.
description: Explore the works of CO2_Karbondioksida (Malaysia), Vicente Delgado (Spain/Singapore), Lee YeSeung (Republic of Korea), Souliya Phoumivong (Laos), Wyn-Lyn Tan (Singapore), Hiromi Tango (Japan/Australia), and Fern Wong (Singapore). Their art is inspired by Mohammed Salehuddin’s Malay House in Malacca, offering a diverse range of perspectives and creative expressions. This exhibition provides an engaging and educational experience for children and families, fostering an appreciation for art and culture from different regions. The showcase aims to spark curiosity and inspire young minds through interactive and thought-provoking installations. Each artist brings a unique style and vision, making this a memorable and enriching experience for all visitors. The exhibition is designed to be family-friendly, encouraging interaction and learning through art.

title: Tiny Tales at National Gallery by Play Scene
blurb: Discover stories behind installations with Play Scene.
description: Embark on a journey of exploration as we uncover the stories and adventures behind our installations. Learn more about the 4 themes of Love, Joy, Kindness, and Dreams with storytellers from Play Scene Ltd. Join us to discover the magic behind art and storytelling, creating memorable experiences for families and children alike. The meeting point for the Mopey Monkey sessions on 31 May and 8 June is Dance Dance Chromatics by Wyn-Lyn Tan, Level 1, City Hall Alcove, City Hall Wing. Don't miss this opportunity to engage with art in a fun and interactive way!
datetime_display: 31 May, 8 Jun, 6 Sept, 7 Sept, 1 Nov, 6 Dec 2025, 7 Mar, 8 Mar 2026 | 3pm | Various Locations

title: Keppel Centre for Art Education
blurb: Explore art through play and interactive exhibits.
description: The Keppel Centre for Art Education offers a variety of interactive exhibits and art-making activities designed to engage children and families with art. Through hands-on experiences, visitors can learn about different art techniques, explore their creativity, and develop an appreciation for art. The centre provides a welcoming and stimulating environment for children to discover the world of art in a fun and educational way. It features different zones catering to various age groups and interests, ensuring an enriching experience for all family members. The centre aims to foster a lifelong love for art and creativity in young visitors, making it a must-visit destination for families.

title: Gallery Children's Biennale at National Gallery
blurb: Explore art through interactive installations.
description: The Gallery Children’s Biennale offers a unique opportunity for children and families to engage with art in an interactive and meaningful way. Through various installations and activities, young visitors can explore different themes and concepts, fostering creativity and imagination. The Biennale aims to create a fun and educational experience for children of all ages, encouraging them to discover the world of art and express themselves. The event features artworks designed to stimulate curiosity and provide hands-on learning experiences. Families can enjoy a day of artistic exploration and discovery together, making it a memorable outing for everyone. The installations are designed to be accessible and engaging, ensuring that children can easily connect with the art and develop an appreciation for creativity. The Biennale also includes various programmes and tours tailored for families and kids, enhancing the overall experience.
